paper_abstract: This work draws upon a recent result (Pekerman et al., 2008) [3] on self-intersection detection and elimination for planar curves, which attempted to eliminate redundant algebraic components. We extend this result to surfaces and bivariate functions. An algebraic decomposition is presented that reformulates the surface self-intersection problem using an alternative set of constraints, while removing the redundant components. Extensions to higher dimensions are also briefly discussed. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Surface self-intersection computation via algebraic decomposition
